title: tezuka's_star_system
body:
A "multiverse" created by [[Tezuka Osamu]] involving character of his works making appearance in his other works, typically in other roles as if they were playing a role like a "real life actors". Many characters were reused from his other works, while some (such as [[Rock (tezuka osamu)|]]) were created specifically as a "superstar" who appeared in several works rather than having one of their own.

[expand=Description from Tezuka Osamu's official site]
The "star system" employed in Tezuka Osamu's Manga differed slightly from its Hollywood namesake, with the characters who appear being handled just like movie [[actor]]s. In other words, as one actor takes on a variety of different roles, so individual characters were given different parts to play.

Aside from the works of Tezuka Osamu, no other Manga artists were using this visionary formula in their writing. It was inconceivable that the star of one Manga would appear as a backseat player in another, and in the guise of the villain at that. 

Nonetheless, Tezuka Osamu thought of his characters as real live actors and actresses and took great pleasure in his role as director in assigning roles to them. Readers who spotted [[Atom (tetsuwan atom)|]] in the guise of the son of a kidnapper in another work would smile with delight. 

Tezuka Osamu even went so far as to think up appearance fees for his characters and his Manga-making techniques overlapped with movie production methods in many ways.
[/expand]

h4. External link
* "Tezukaosamu.net article of the Star System":[https://tezukaosamu.net/en/character/star_system.html]

title: darun_mister
body:
[[Arika]] character, first debuting in [[Street Fighter EX (series)|]], before later appearing in [[Fighting EX Layer]].

He is a [[dark skin|black]] Indian [[wrestling]] champion with a traditional Indian jewel on his forehead and a V-shaped [[mustache]]. He wears black wrestling trunks and boots and gold bracelets on his wrist.

He hears of [[Zangief]]'s legendary wrestling prowess and, bored with his inferior opponents, seeks out the Russian to prove to himself that he is indeed the world's ultimate fighter. He also acts as a bodyguard for [[Pullum Purna]].

title: nowhere_(signalis)
body:
[quote][b][i]PERHAPS, THIS IS HELL[/i][/b][/quote]

A mysterious location in [[Signalis]]'s setting, accessed through a black [[gate]] deep underground on the planet Leng. Nowhere consists of two main places:
* What appears to be a twisted recreation of various places in the S-23 Sierpinski prison complex arranged haphazardly in a non-Euclidean fashion.
* [spoiler]A barren red wasteland dominated by rolling hills and black, rectangular structures poking out of the ground at odd angles. This area is also littered with [[corpse|dead]] [[Elster (Signalis)|Elster units]], and contains the wreckage of the Penrose-512 [[spacecraft]].[/spoiler]

title: gladiator
body:
A [[warrior]] who fights (often [[slave|unwillingly]]) as a form of mass entertainment, in a [[colosseum]] or other arena.

The arms and armor of such fighters tend towards the spectacular-but-impractical, since spectacle is the whole point. In fantasy works, men often will be [[topless male|bare-chested]], while women often will be wearing [[bikini armor]].

Historically, gladiators originate in the ancient [[Roman Empire]].

title: godzilla_earth
body:
[b]Godzilla Earth[/b], also simply known as [b]Godzilla[/b], is the first [[Godzilla]] of the Anime [[Godzilla (series)|]] continuity, and the second Godzilla within the Toho reboot series of films.

This version of Godzilla made his first formal appearance in the prequel novel, Godzilla: Monster Apocalypse, where it's detailed how Godzilla arose in 2030 and proceeded to lay waste to both humanity and the planet's monster population over the course of 18 years.

Godzilla Earth is by far the largest form of Godzilla yet, standing at nearly 300 meters. This also making it one of the largest [[kaiju|kaiju]] of the entire franchise.

title: instance_domination
body: A pose from the [[SSSS.Dynazenon]] portion of the [[Gridman Universe]] signified by a hand raised to eye or near eye level and split into a V shape from the middle and ring fingers. Often accompanied by a flash of light, a change in eye color or a glint near the eyes. This is performed when a character from the series uses their powers to take control of a [[Kaiju]].

title: keizer_ghidorah

body:

[b]Kaijuu Parasites[/b] are a small type of parasites that are attached to the body of [[Kaiju]]. They are similar to ticks and about the size of a human baby.

title: gigan
body:
A [[kaiju|kaiju]] from [[Godzilla (series)|]] series.

Gigan is a peculiar [[alien]] [[cyborg]] kaiju with several parts of its body modified with cybernetic parts. Most notably a large [[visor cap]], a hooked blade in place of an arm, and a saw blade protruding from its stomach.

It was generally depicted as being controlled by an alien and used as a weapon to aid in their intergalactic conquest.

title: king_ghidorah
body:
A [[kaiju|kaiju]] from [[Godzilla (series)|Godzilla]] series, first appeared in its own standalone movie [i]Ghidorah, the Three-Headed Monster[/i] (1964). Since its debut, King Ghidorah has the most theatrical appearance of any kaiju within the series bar Godzilla itself, thus it is often considered an arch-enemy of [[Godzilla]].

King Ghidorah is a large, yellow, [[multiple_heads|three-headed]] [[dragon]] with an ability to shoot lightning bolt from its mouth. It is typically depicted as an alien kaiju who brought devastation upon any planet it made a landfall.

In some depictions, each head of King Ghidorah has its own personality, which led to the characters within that media to name each of Ghidorah's head based on their behavior.

h4. See also
* [[Three-headed dragon (meme)]]

title: king_kong_vs._godzilla
body:
A 1962 Japanese [[kaiju]] film directed by Honda Ishirō, with special effects by [[Tsuburaya Eiji]]. Produced and distributed by Toho Co., Ltd, it is the third film in both the [[Godzilla (series)|]] and [[King Kong (series)|]] franchises.

For the 2021 film, see [[Godzilla vs. Kong]].

h4.External links
* "Wikipedia: King Kong vs. Godzilla":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_Kong_vs._Godzilla
other_names: キングコング対ゴジラ

title: akaishi_kuroe
body: The main character of [[Otome Kaijuu Carameliser]], she is antisocial and often mocked by her classmates. She has an unknown condition that causes her to grow a tail and monstrous  arms when emotionally charged, and when pushed too far, causes her to [[transformation|transform]] into a [[kaiju]] named [[Harugon]].

title: kitoralsus
body:
A species from [i][[Shinkansen Henkei Robo Shinkalion]][/i] that lived on Earth's surface in ancient times, but was forced underground after the meteor that destroyed the dinosaurs collided with the planet. There are very few of them alive at the point of the series, and they send [[kaiju]] to the surface to attack humanity. 

They look similar to humans, although they have [[red eyes|red]] or [[yellow eyes]], [[pale skin]], and either very light [[blonde hair|blonde]] or [[grey hair]]. Some of them have been shown to be able to take on forms indistinguishable from humans, although Genbu and Torame are notable for looking much more monstrous and inhuman compared to the others. They can also take upon kaijuu forms themselves when infused with the black particles they use to create kaijuu on the surface.

[spoilers]The movie reveals that the underground Kitoralsus are not the only group, and that other groups, descended from Kitoralsus that left the planet after the meteor strike, are still present in space and waiting for a chance to return to earth[/spoilers]

h4.Known Kitoralsus

title: onibaba
body:
A fictional [[Kaiju]] [[monster]] from the [[Pacific Rim]] science fiction [[mecha]] series. It first appeared in the live action film from 2013.

[b]Onibaba[/b] (鬼婆) means "demon hag" in Japanese.

title: kurukuru_(sekai_seifuku)
body:
Little ball-shaped creatures used and possibly invented by Zvezda. They can fuse together into [[kaiju]] (it takes a few thousands of them to form one, though), as individuals they have a form of sentience (to what extent exactly is not known yet) and can also serve as an impromptu inflatable shield (capable of withstanding a few bursts of automatic gun fire), as a hot-air-balloon-like flying device and as a magic satchel (storing a bag bigger than their usual size would normally allow). [[natasha_(sekai_seifuku)|Natasha]] can generate them from her tears as an emergency measure, although how that exactly works, wasn't revealed.

Ambiguous tag. 

The artist formerly tagged here was divided into [[Soutou]] and [[Kurukuru_(P!)]]. 

For some potential artists named Kurukuru: "kurukuru_* search":[/artist?name=kurukuru_*] | "*_kurukuru search":[/artist?name=*_kurukuru]

title: shinkansen_henkei_robo_shinkalion
body:
The first TV anime in the [[Shinkalion (series)|]] franchise, aired from 2018 to 2019 and was followed by a film in late 2019. A sequel, [[Shinkansen Henkei Robo Shinkalion Z]], began airing in April 2021.

The anime focuses on [[Hayasugi Hayato]], who unintentionally finds out his father is a member of a secret government organization that uses the eponymous mecha to fight [[kaiju]] sent by the [[Kitoralsus]]. He becomes the pilot of the [[E5 Hayabusa (shinkalion)|]], and makes friends with other kids who are recruited as pilots alongside him.

title: kaname_(cencoroll)
body:
A character from the manga and film series [[Cencoroll]]. She is a girl who comes to the town where [[tetsu_(cencoroll)|Tetsu]] lives in search of [[shuu_(cencoroll)|Shuu]]. She shows to possess control over more than one [[Cenco]]-like creatures. She first appeared in the 2019 movie [[cencoroll_connect|Cencoroll Connect]].

She has [[black eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]]. She wears a [[white shirt]], [[black skirt]], a [[black necktie]], [[black thighhighs]] and [[glasses]].

She is usually depicted with her [[kaiju|kaiju]] [[hanpen_(cencoroll)|Hanpen]].

She is voiced by [[Takamori Natsumi]].

h4. See Also

* "MyAnimeList: Kaname":https://myanimelist.net/character/177505/Kaname

title: zilla
body:
A [[kaiju|kaiju]] appearing in the 1998 Hollywood film [i][[Godzilla (series)|]][/i] created by Sony Pictures.

It was initially labelled as a "[[Godzilla]]" within the movie, but was subsequently retconned into simply "Zilla" by Toho Films due too how unfaithful to the original it is compared to the original source material. Particularly being designed a lean and relatively small (for a kaiju standard) lizard-like creature, compared to the established theropod-like kaiju design of the original Godzilla.

It has been a subject of ridicule by Toho and fans to the point that Toho has released a reference to it, considering the monster an entirely different species, as well as including it in a [[godzilla_(series)|Godzilla]] anime series only for it to be beaten by the original Godzilla in [i]13 seconds[/i].

title: bioluminescence
body:
Light produced by chemical reactions inside living organisms. It occurs in a diverse array of living species, including fungi, microscopic plankton, [[jellyfish]], [[squid]], and [[anglerfish]].

[[Fireflies]] are likely the most familiar terrestrial example of bioluminescence in nature. In anime art, they are ubiquitous in outdoor environments during summer nights. To avoid crowding out all the less common uses of this tag, fireflies shouldn't be tagged [[bioluminescence]].

h4. See also

* [[kaiju]]

title: shimo_(monsterverse)
body:
A [[MonsterVerse]] [[kaiju|kaiju]] first debuted in [[Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire]].

Shimo is a massive white sauropod kaiju with an ability to release ice beam. She is currently the largest kaiju in MonsterVerse, standing at over 162 meters, making her even taller than [[Godzilla (monsterverse)|]] or [[King Ghidorah (monsterverse)|]], though her size is usually made less apparent by her preference to walk on all fours.

She was enslaved by [[Skar King]], who uses her as his personal mount in an attempt to overthrow [[Kong (monsterverse)|]] as the ruler of the Hollow Earth [spoiler]Eventually, Shimo was freed and saved by Kong and Godzilla after the duo managed to defeat and kill Skar, and would eventually served as Kong's subordinates in Hollow Earth.[/spoiler]

title: grimm_(rwby)
body:
Fictional species of [[monster|monsters]] from [[RWBY]], a Rooster Teeth series. They are described as "creatures of destruction" which lack souls. Hostile to humanity and drawn towards sources of negative emotions (fear, sorrow, etc.).  

Grimm are commonly black, with white armored patches, red markings, and [[glowing_eyes|glowing]] [[red eyes]].  

h4. Species

* [[Beowolf]] - resembling large wolves or werewolves
* [[Beringel]] - bulky gorilla
* [[Boarbatusk]] - large boar
* [[creep_(RWBY)|Creep]] - resembles theropod dinosaurs but lacks forelimbs
* [[death_stalker (rwby)|Death Stalker]] - giant scorpion
* [[geist_(rwby)|Geist]] - ghost-like creature with one eye on an otherwise blank face(plate), two arms, and waist trails instead of legs; can possess inanimate objects, exposing only its faceplate
** [[Armor Gigas]] - A western-style suit of full plate armor with greatsword, stated in manga to be animated by a possession-type Grimm
** [[Petra Gigas]] - A golem-like collection of boulders possessed by a Geist.
* [[goliath_(rwby)|Goliath]] - elephant
* [[Griffon_(rwby)|Griffon]] - griffin
* [[Grimm Dragon]] - giant wyvern
* [[the_hound_(rwby)|The Hound]] - [spoiler]Intelligent Grimm, capable of shapeshifting and speech, with a debatably-alive Faunus as a "core"[/spoiler]
* [[King Taijitu]] - giant double-headed snake (one head on each end, no tail)
* [[Leviathan_(rwby)|Leviathan]] - Gargantuan [[kaiju]]-like mosnter resembling and fighting like [[Godzilla]]
* [[manticore_(rwby)|Manticore]] - Fireball-breathing winged lion
* [[monstra_(rwby)|Monstra]] - [spoiler]Colossal flying whale used by [[salem_(rwby)|Salem]] as "living" transport and mothership[/spoiler]
* [[nevermore_(rwby)|Nevermore]] - raven, appears in both normal-crow-sized and giant-sized varieties
* [[nuckelavee_(rwby)|Nuckelavee]] - Nightmare horse with legless humanoid "rider" fused onto center of horseback; "rider" can stretch arms to attack
* Orochi ([i]name?[/i]) - Appears in manga; [spoiler]fuses 4 King Taijitu into one eight-headed monster ([[blake_belladonna|Blake]] references Yamata-no-Orochi when talking about it)[/spoiler]
* [[Sabyr_(rwby)|Sabyr]] - Resembles a [[smilodon]] or [[sabertooth cat]]
* [[Sea Feilong]] - Japanese dragon, [spoiler]can swim or extend fins into wings to fly, breathes electric energy beam[/spoiler]
* [[sphinx_(rwby)|Sphinx]] - Larger Manticore Grimm whose tail is a snake head/body
* [[ursa_(rwby)|Ursa]] - large bear (plural Ursai, larger ones may be called Ursa Major)

title: mothra
body:
A giant [[moth]] [[kaiju|kaiju]] from the [[Godzilla (series)|Godzilla]] series.

Unlike the other kaijus, Mothra is almost always depicted as a heroic kaiju (unlike [[Godzilla]] who typically takes the role of an anto-protagonist), almost always act as the protector of the Earth, nature, and civilizations. She is also one the rare female kaijus in the series, and can also communicate with humans via her accompanied [[fairy]] followers.

Due to her popularity, she is often referred to as the "queen of the monsters" and the "nature's goddess".

title: akihabara_radio_kaikan
body:
The Akihabara Radio Kaikan (秋葉原ラジオ会館, Akihabara Rajio Kaikan), Akihabara Radio Hall is a commercial building in Tokyo, Japan and is one of the most well-known landmarks in the Akihabara district. The recent building was built in 2014 after the old building was demolished in 2011. The building is 46.5 m high, is ten levels from the ground floor and has two basement levels.  The current building primarily hosts stores selling otaku goods. ("Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihabara_Radio_Kaikan)

The building plays a prominent role in the [[Steins;Gate]] franchise.

title: bamboo_slips
body:
Bamboo and wooden slips (simplified Chinese: 简牍; traditional Chinese: 簡牘; pinyin: jiǎndú) are long, narrow strips of wood or bamboo, each typically holding a single column of several dozen brush-written characters. They were the main media for writing documents in China before the widespread introduction of paper during the first two centuries AD.

h4. See also

* [[Scroll]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bamboo and wooden slips":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bamboo_and_wooden_slips]

title: miao
body:
The Miao are a group of linguistically-related peoples living in Southern China and Southeast Asia, which are recognized by the government of China as one of the 56 official ethnic groups. The Miao live primarily in southern China's mountains, in the provinces of Guizhou, Yunnan, Sichuan, Hubei, Hunan, Guangxi, Guangdong and Hainan. Some sub-groups of the Miao, most notably the [[Hmong]] people, have migrated out of China into Southeast Asia (Myanmar, Northern Vietnam, Laos and Thailand). Following the communist takeover of Laos in 1975, a large group of Hmong refugees resettled in several Western nations, mainly in the United States, France and Australia.

h4. See also
* [[Miao clothes]]
** [[Miao clothes]]
** [[Miao hat]]

h4. External links

title: f-5_freedom_fighter
body:
The [b]Northrop F-5A/B Freedom Fighter[/b] is part of a family of lightweight twin-engine [[jet]] fighter developed by Northrop in the 1950s and first produced in 1962. The aircraft was later modified into the [[f-5 freedom fighter|F-5E/F Tiger II]], a more advanced version introduced in 1972. 

Cheap, easy to operate and maintain, the F-5 is still in wide use with several air forces worldwide. It is equipped with a flat fuselage underside with a small tailhook; clipped-delta wings with wingtip missile rails and fixed armament comprising 2 20mm cannons in its nose. Up to 7,000 lbs (3,200 kg) of fuel stores can be carried on its weapon stations.

h4. See also

* [[F-20 Tigershark]]
* [[Area 88]]
* [[List of Airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Northrop F-5":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_F-5

title: asatsuki_(cookie)
body:
* !post #1898981

The first voice actress candidate for [[Konpaku Youmu|]] in [[Cookie (Touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]]. She declined the offer after fearing the community. Although her account name is Asatsuki (朝月), she is called  ASUTEKA (Japanese pronunciation for "[[aztec|Azteca]]") by community, and has been drawn as a tribal version of Youmu with [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]].

Somewhat similar to [[Kochiko (cookie)|]] she wasn't very good at singing due to her distinct voice. This began the joke that her voice would cause the Mayan apocalypse, involving raining [[Olmec head]]s, spontaneous [[mesoamerican architecture|Mesoamerican]] [[pyramid (structure)|]]s, and explosions.

title: f-22_raptor
body:
The [b]Lockheed Martin F-22 Raptor[/b] is an American fifth generation single-seat, twin-engine state-of-the-art advanced fighter [[aircraft]] that uses stealth technology. It was designed primarily as an air superiority fighter, but has several additional capabilities that include ground attack, electronic warfare and reconnaissance. 

The F-22 was developed from the original YF-22 prototype flight tested during 1990. The first mass produced F-22s first flew in 1997 and were officially introduced several years later in 2005. 

The F-22 is the first mass produced fifth generation aircraft ever created and is still considered the most advanced operational fighter jet in the world. Lockheed Martin Aeronautics and Boeing Defense continue to be major partners in maintaining the United States of America Raptor fleet. 

h4. Other fifth generation jets

* [[F-35 Lightning II]]
* [[su-57|Sukhoi PAK FA]]
* [[Chengdu j-20]]
* [[Shenyang j-31]]

h4. See also

* [[FB-22]]
* [[List of airplanes]]
* "Lockheed-Martin webpage":http://www.lockheedmartin.com/us/products/f22.html
* Wikipedia: "Lockheed-Martin F-22 Raptor":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_Martin_F-22_Raptor

title: f-35_lightning_ii
body:
The [b]Lockheed Martin F-35 Lightning II[/b] is a family of single-seat, single-engine, fifth generation multirole [[jet]] fighters under development to perform ground attack, reconnaissance, and air defense missions with stealth capability. 

The F-35 has three main models: the F-35A is a conventional takeoff and landing variant, the F-35B is a Short Take-Off and Vertical Landing variant (with [[VTOL]] capability while not carrying additional armament), and the F-35C is a heavier carrier-based variant.

The JSF program was designed to replace the United States military [[f-16 fighting falcon|F-16]]s, [[A-10 Thunderbolt II|A-10]]s, [[f-18 hornet|F-18]]s (excluding newer E/F "Super Hornet" variants) and [[hawker harrier|AV-8B]]s tactical fighter aircraft.

The Shenyang [[Shenyang j-31]] is very similar to this jet.

h4.See also

* [[F-22 Raptor]]
* [[List of Airplanes]]

title: shenyang_j-15
body:
The [b]Shenyang J-15[/b] (simplified Chinese: 歼-15; traditional Chinese: 殲-15) is an advanced carrier-based, twin-engine fourth/four-point-five-generation multirole [[fighter jet]] being developed by the [i]Shenyang Aerospace Corporation[/i] specifically for the Chinese [[People's Liberation Army Navy|People's Liberation Army Naval Air Force]] (PLANAF). It was reversed-engineered from the T-10K-3, a [[Su-33]] (navalized [[Su-27]]) prototype purchased from [[Ukraine]] in 2001, and further developed to use indigenous technologies from the [[Shenyang j-11|J-11B]] program.

The J-15 conducted its first takeoff from a simulated ski-jump on land on May 7, 2010. On November 25, 2012, the aircraft successfully performed its first takeoff and landing on [[liaoning_(aircraft_carrier)|Liaoning]], China's first operational [[aircraft carrier]]. It entered mass production in December 2013. The J-15 is viewed as an interim carrier-based fighter until a fifth-generation successor enters service, one that may be based on the Chengdu [[Chengdu j-20]] or Shenyang [[Shenyang j-31]].

The J-15 features a internal 30mm [[cannon]] and 12 external hardpoints which can mount the [[PL-8]] and [[PL-10]] infrared-homing air-to-air [[missile|missiles]], the [[PL-12]] and [[PL-15]] active-radar air-to-air missiles, the [[YJ-38]] anti-ship missile, the [[KD-88]] air-to-ground missile, the [[YJ-91]] anti-radar missile, a variety of bombs, rockets, and the UPAZ-1A buddy refueling pod. A two-seater variant used for electronic warfare exists. Starting from the J-15B it was upgraded with CATOBAR launch capability, AESA radar, and stealth coatings. As of 2023, at least 60 airframes have been produced.

h4. See also

* [[Shenyang j-16]]
* [[Su-33]]
* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Shenyang J-15":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shenyang_J-15

title: shenyang_j-16
body:
The [b]Shenyang J-16[/b] (simplified Chinese: 歼-16; traditional Chinese: 殲-16) is an advanced tandem-seat, twin-engine fourth-generation multirole [[fighter jet]] being developed by the [i]Shenyang Aerospace Corporation[/i] for the Chinese [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]] (PLAAF). It was developed from the Shenyang [[Shenyang j-11]], which in turn was developed as an indigenous variant of the Russian [[Su-27]].

The J-16 made its maiden flight between 2011–2012 (est), and entered service in 2014. The electronic warfare version of the fighter, named J-16D, was developed in 2010s and reportedly made its first flight in 2015. The J-16 platform is rumored to be the foundation for research-and-development into advanced autonomous combat capabilities.  In March 2021, it was reported that a J-16 variant with the backseat co-pilot replaced by an artificial intelligence algorithm called "intelligence victory" (智胜) was undergoing testing at Shenyang Aircraft Corporation.

The J-16 has a 30mm [[cannon]] and a total of 12 external hardpoints which can carry [[PL-10]] infrared-homing air-to-air [[missile|missiles]], [[PL-15]] and [[PL-21]] active-radar homing missiles, [[YJ-83]] anti-ship missiles, [[KD-88]] air-to-ground missiles, as well as bombs, rockets, and external targeting pods. The J-16D replaces the cannon with an internal electronics warfare system and carries wingmounted pods. As of early November 2022, 245+ J-16 airframes have been produced. 

h4. See also

* [[Shenyang j-15]]
* [[Su-27]]
* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Shenyang J-16":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shenyang_J-16

title: chengdu_j-10
body:
The [b]Chengdu J-10 "Vigorous Dragon" (威龙)[/b] (simplified Chinese: 歼-10; traditional Chinese: 殲-10) is a single-engined [[canards|canard]]-and-delta-wing fourth-generation multirole [[fighter jet]] produced by the [i]Chengdu Aircraft Industry Corporation[/i] for the Chinese [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]] (PLAAF), [[People's Liberation Army Navy|People's Liberation Army Naval Air Force]] (PLANAF) and the [[Pakistan Air Force]] (PAF). 

The J-10 made its maiden flight on 23 March 1998, and entered operation in 2006. The J-10 is mainly designed for air-to-air combat, but can also perform strike missions. It features 11 hardpoints which can carry [[PL-8]] and [[PL-10]] infrared-homing air-to-air [[missile|missiles]], [[PL-12]] and [[PL-15]] active-radar air-to-air missiles, [[KD-88]] air-to-ground missiles, or [[YJ-91]] anti-radiation air-to-ground missiles as well as bombs (guided and unguided), fuel tanks, or a variety of targeting pods.

As of 2022, there have been 602+ airframes of all J-10 variants produced.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* [[Chengdu j-10]]
* Not to be confused with [[J-10 (muv-luv)|]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Chengdu J-10":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chengdu_J-10

title: yuezheng_longya
body:
[b]Yuezheng Longya[/b] (乐正龙牙) is a part of the [[vsinger (vocaloid)|Vocaloid China]] project. He's described as a forthright person with a sister complex; his sister is [[Yuezheng Ling]]. His family owns a large music corporation, in which he hopes to become the president of.

He is formerly known as [b]Yayin[/b] (牙音), an [[original]] [[Vocaloid]] character illustrated by ayaya. His design was a top rank choice during the "Vocaloid China Project".

His voicebank was released on June 26th, 2017.

title: sol_qamar_(idolmaster)
body:
Sol Qamar is an idol unit featured in THE iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls, consisting of the idols: Layla and Natalia.

Their first appearance together as a unit was on January 9th, 2015, as a 9th Idol LIVE Royale rival unit, before given their current name, which was revealed on January 10th, 2017, as a 21st Idol LIVE Royale rival unit in the mobile game Cinderella Girls.
Their unit names in order include:

Tropical Country New Year (南国ニューイヤー Nangoku Nyuu Iyaa) - Debut on January 9th, 2015, marking their first official unit appearance.
Plains Walk Dancers (プレーンズウォーク・ダンサーズ Pureenzu Wooku Dansaazu) - Debut on October 21st, 2015.
Arabian Dancers (アラビアンダンサーズ Arabian Dansaazu) - Debut on July 8th, 2016.
Sol Qamar (ソル・カマル Soru Kamaru) - Debut on January 10th, 2017. This is their unit name from onwards.

Their unit name is a mix of two languages: Portuguese and Arabic. Sol means sun in Portuguese, and Qamar (قمر) means moon in Arabic.

title: nakano_yotsuba
body:
A character in [[Go-toubun no Hanayome]] and fourth of the Nakano [[quintuplets|Quintuplet]] sisters. Yotsuba is always cheerful, friendly, and good at sports. However, her constantly active personality can annoy others. She likes watching anime and her best subject is Japanese.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[orange hair]] [[bob cut]] stylized with [[bangs]] & [[hair between eyes]]. She wears a [[green ribbon|green]] [[hair ribbon]] and her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], [[yellow sweater]]/[[yellow sweater vest]], [[plaid bow|plaid]] [[green bow]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], and [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]].

Her [[voice actor|voice actress]] is [[Sakura Ayane]].

title: flower_on_head
body:
Use this tag when a flower (or a bunch of flowers) [b]grows[/b] on top of a character's head, usually with a stem and a set of leaves. The [[pikmin_(creature)|Pikmins]] from the [[pikmin (series)|eponymous series]] are examples of this tag.

In anime and manga, a flower growing from a character’s head is sometimes an allusion to the Japanese term "脳内お花畑 (nōnai o-hanabatake)":[https://www.japandict.com/%E8%84%B3%E5%86%85%E3%81%8A%E8%8A%B1%E7%95%91] - literally "garden in the brain" - symbolizing that a character is being "carefree, happy-go-lucky, silly, or stupid":[https://www.japanesewithanime.com/2021/06/flower-on-head.html]. Examples of this would be [[shinomiya_kaguya|Kaguya]] in her “bakaguya”/moron mode and [[pallas_(arknights)|Pallas]] from [[Arknights]].

Not to be confused with [[hair flower]].

h4. See also

* [[hair flower]]
* [[head wreath]]
* [[plant hair]]
* [[plant on head]]

title: blowtorch
body:
Also referred to as a blowlamp, a blowtorch is an ambient air fuel-burning tool used for applying flame and heat to various applications, usually in metalworking. The most common and known variant is the handheld propane torch, whose main use is for soldering and brazing.

Not to be confused with [[flamethrower]], which is a weapon designed to launch fire at distance.

h4. External Links

"Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blowtorch?useskin=vector]

title: akg_k-series_headphones
body:
For tagging purposes, [[headphones]] with a structure resembling [[Akiyama Mio]]'s AKG K701.

Most of them happen to be AKG K-something, but some others (Q701 for example) have a similar look and structure and still count. Likewise, headphones technically in the K-series that don't share this look (such as K553 with a different headband) don't count. If you can think of a better name for the tag, bring it up in the forum.

Notable visual traits:
* Large circular cups with a smaller circular section sticking out in the middle
* Headband with a pair of almost-parallel sticks separate from the pad that rests on the head, usually with visible circular attachment points

* !asset #22087836: K701[br][url=https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:AKG_K701_headphones.jpg]Jud McCranie, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons[/url]
* !asset #22087837: K240[br][url=https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:AKG_K240_headphones.jpg]Jud McCranie, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons[/url]

body:

title: rpr
body:
Streamer and retired professional [[Apex Legends]] player under [[SCARZ]], until retiring from competition in April 2023. Often plays Apex and other games alongside members of [[Hololive]], [[Nijisanji EN]], and [[VSPO!]].

h4. Appearance
While he primarily streams with facecam, he has an illustrated character design of himself (post #4844361) by an anonymous artist. 
On May 29, 2022, he debuted a [[virtual YouTuber]] model (post #5390484) illustrated by [[LAM (ramdayo)|]] and [[live2D]] rigged by [[Keffiy]].

title: laibaht
body:
A female Thai [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber]]. In [[thai text|Thai]], the name "หลายบาท" literally means "Many Baht", baht (บาท) referring to the [[money|currency]] of Thailand.

h4. Appearance
She has [[blue eyes]], [[blonde hair|blonde]]-[[aqua hair|aqua]] [[long hair]] with [[hair flaps|flaps]], bangs that extends [[hair between eyes|past her eyes]] ([[double-parted bangs]]), and an [[ahoge]]. She also wears [[hairclip]]s and a [[black choker]].
